textBox.richText: These massive killings, meant to rid the country of communist revolutionaries, were the method in which Suharto began his thirty-year rule as president of Indonesia. More than 500,000 are estimated to have been killed, while more than a million were imprisoned at one point or another. So far, I have only found a single monograph, listed on the Bibliography of the Indonesian Massacres page, but the number of sources there will undoubtedly be added to as I receive suggestions.
